meanings.definition: A person of unusually small stature
meanings.sent1: In the fairy tale, the dwarfs helped Snow White on her journey.
meanings.sent2: The group of dwarfs worked together in the mine.
meanings.sent3: The dwarfs tried to reach the top shelf but couldn't quite make it.
meanings.sent4: Compared to the giant, the dwarf seemed like a tiny speck.
meanings.sent5: The dwarf stood out in the crowd due to his small stature.

meanings.definition: To cause to appear small in size
meanings.sent1: The large tree dwarfs the tiny flower beside it.
meanings.sent2: The massive building dwarfs the surrounding houses.
meanings.sent3: The huge cake dwarfs the small cupcakes next to it.
meanings.sent4: His talent dwarfs that of his competitors in the competition.
meanings.sent5: The mountain range dwarfs the hills in the distance.

meanings.definition: A small star of faint luminosity
meanings.sent1: The astronomer observed the dwarfs through the telescope.
meanings.sent2: The night sky was filled with twinkling dwarfs.
meanings.sent3: The dwarfs in the galaxy seemed to wink at the observer.
meanings.sent4: The dwarf shone dimly among the brighter stars.
meanings.sent5: The dwarf added a subtle glow to the vast expanse of space.
